bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the Superior Court of the State of Washington For King County.

I, Kenneth Mackintosh, prosecuting attorney in and for the County of King, state of Washington, now here in the name of and by the authority of the State of Washington, and gives the court to understand and to be informed, and now on oath by this information do accuse Earnest Hutchinson fo the crime of selling Trading Stamps, commiteed as follows, to-wit:

He, the said Earnest Hutchinson, in the County of King, State of Washington, on the 3rd day of July, A. D., 1905, did then and there sell four thousand (4000) trading stamps to one E. London for the sum of twenty dollars ($20.00) in lawful money of the United States, upon a contarct to enable said E. London to sell or exchange property upon a representation, advertisement, notice or inducement that aid trading stamps would entitle a person purchasing goods of said E. London to demand or receive from said Earnest Hutchinson other property unselected by or unidentified by said purchaser to receive from said Earnest Hutchinson other property unselected by or unidentified by said puchaser to reeive from said earnest Hutchinson property whose selection would depend upon chance or hazard, said property ot be delivered and received as a part of the transaction as a prize, premium, or premium gift contrary to the form of the statute is said case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of Washington.
Dated at Seattle in the County and state aforesaid, this 25th day of July, 1905.
Kenneth Mackintosh. Prosecuting Attorney in and for the County of King, State of Washington.
State of Washington. County of King

Kenneth Mackintosh, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says, that he is prosecuting attorney in and for the county of King, State of Washington; that he ahs read the foregoing in-formation, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 25th day of July, 1905. Otto A. Case. Clerk of the Superior Court in and for the County of King, State of Washington.
By O. H. Springer, Deputy. Witnesses for the State: Fred G. Corliss. E. London.
